historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For Law 18-184, see notes following § 7-2361.01.

Uniform Law

This section is based upon § 6 of the Uniform Emergency Volunteer Health Practitioners Act. See Vol. 9, Part 1B, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE § 7-2361.05

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: While an emergency declaration is in effect, a volunteer health practitioner registered with a registration system that complies with § 7- 2361.04 and licensed and in good standing in the state upon which the practitioner's registration is based may practice in the District to the extent authorized by this chapter as if the practitioner were licensed in the District.

A volunteer health practitioner qualified under subsection (a) of this section is not entitled to the protections of this chapter if the practitioner is licensed in more than one state and any license of the practitioner is suspended, revoked, or subject to an agency order limiting or restricting practice privileges, or has been voluntarily terminated under threat of sanction.

title.text: Human Health Care and Safety. (Refs & Annos)

chapter.text: Uniform Emergency Volunteer Health Practitioners. (Refs & Annos)

heading.catch_text: Recognition of volunteer health practitioners licensed in other states.
